trans-unit.source: How can you measure users’ opinions and attitudes toward brands or topics in online social networks, such as Facebook posts, tweets, reviews, etc.?
trans-unit.target: How can you measure users’ opinions and attitudes toward brands or topics in online social networks, such as Facebook posts, tweets, reviews, etc.?

trans-unit.source: Sentiment analysis provides a method for analyzing such questions.
trans-unit.target: Sentiment analysis provides a method for analyzing such questions.

trans-unit.source: There are generally two methods for sentiment analysis.
trans-unit.target: There are generally two methods for sentiment analysis.

trans-unit.source: One is using a supervised learning algorithm, and the other can be treated as unsupervised learning.
trans-unit.target: One is using a supervised learning algorithm, and the other can be treated as unsupervised learning.

trans-unit.source: A supervised learning algorithm generally builds a classification model on a large annotated corpus.
trans-unit.target: A supervised learning algorithm generally builds a classification model on a large annotated corpus.

trans-unit.source: Its accuracy is mainly based on the quality of the annotation, and usually the training process will take a long time.
trans-unit.target: Its accuracy is mainly based on the quality of the annotation, and usually the training process will take a long time.

trans-unit.source: Besides that, when we apply the algorithm to another domain, the result is usually not good.
trans-unit.target: Besides that, when we apply the algorithm to another domain, the result is usually not good.

trans-unit.source: Compared to supervised learning, lexicon-based unsupervised learning uses a sentiment dictionary, which doesn’t require storing a large data corpus and training - which makes the whole process much faster.
trans-unit.target: Compared to supervised learning, lexicon-based unsupervised learning uses a sentiment dictionary, which doesn’t require storing a large data corpus and training - which makes the whole process much faster.

trans-unit.source: Our [service](https://datamarket.azure.com/dataset/aml_labs/lexicon_based_sentiment_analysis) is built on the MPQA Subjectivity Lexicon (http://mpqa.cs.pitt.edu/lexicons/subj_lexicon/), which is one of the most commonly used subjectivity lexicons.
trans-unit.target: Our [service](https://datamarket.azure.com/dataset/aml_labs/lexicon_based_sentiment_analysis) is built on the MPQA Subjectivity Lexicon (http://mpqa.cs.pitt.edu/lexicons/subj_lexicon/), which is one of the most commonly used subjectivity lexicons.

trans-unit.source: There are 5097 negative and 2533 positive words in MPQA.
trans-unit.target: There are 5097 negative and 2533 positive words in MPQA.

trans-unit.source: And all of these words are annotated as strong or weak polarity.
trans-unit.target: And all of these words are annotated as strong or weak polarity.

trans-unit.source: The input data can be any text, but the web service works better with short sentences.

trans-unit.source: The output is a numeric value between -1 and 1.
trans-unit.target: The output is a numeric value between -1 and 1.

trans-unit.source: Any value below 0 denotes that the sentiment of the text is negative; positive if above 0.
trans-unit.target: Any value below 0 denotes that the sentiment of the text is negative; positive if above 0.

trans-unit.source: The absolute value of the result denotes the strength of the associated sentiment.
trans-unit.target: The absolute value of the result denotes the strength of the associated sentiment.

trans-unit.source: Limitations
trans-unit.target: Limitations

trans-unit.source: From an algorithm perspective, lexicon-based sentiment analysis is a general sentiment analysis tool, which may not perform better than the classification method for specific fields.
trans-unit.target: From an algorithm perspective, lexicon-based sentiment analysis is a general sentiment analysis tool, which may not perform better than the classification method for specific fields.

trans-unit.source: The negation problem is not well dealt with.
trans-unit.target: The negation problem is not well dealt with.

trans-unit.source: We hardcode several negation words in our program, but a better way is using a negation dictionary and build some rules.
trans-unit.target: We hardcode several negation words in our program, but a better way is using a negation dictionary and build some rules.

trans-unit.source: The web service performs better on short and simple sentences, such as tweets and Facebook posts, than on long and complex sentences such as Amazon reviews.
